What do you want to know?

What is Garbo Monitoring?

Garbo Monitoring is a garbage collection monitoring and notification system designed to monitor garbage collection within the urban areas of Iligan City and to also notify the residents of the said city when it is their schedule for garbage collection.

What is the main objective of Garbo Monitoring?

The main goal of this app is to help the residents of Iligan City locate their respective barangay waste destination points (B.M.R.F. or pickup points) and to inform them what specific day(s) of the week their barangay is scheduled for garbage collection. Through this implementation, the developers believe that the residents of Iligan City don't have to burn their trash every other day which can cause health infections and air pollution.

Limitations of Garbo Monitoring

Garbo Monitoring is still in the development process. Thus, the system is only limited to track five waste destination points as of the moment.

Who are the following developers behind Garbo Monitoring?

The following developers of this app are two 3rd-year college IT students from the Mindanao State University of Iligan Institute of Technology.
